questions.correct: the 2 year anniversary of beating Gary's Olde Towne Tavern at bowling
options: the 2 year anniversary of beating the Celtics in a celebrity/amature basketball game
questions.explanation:
the 2 year anniversary of beating Gary's Olde Towne Tavern at bowling.

	In an earlier episode with Diane, Diane ended up playing for the Cheers team because she felt insulted by Gary. It turned out she was a good bowler because she did it in college as an easy P.E. credit.

questions.text: What was missing from Cheers when they were celebrating?
questions.explanation:
The trophy.

	It was found broken a little later. Sam went to Gary's Olde Towne Tavern but he didn't retaliate. Instead he asked out one of Gary's waitresses.

questions.text: What did Al say when Carla asked him why he was not at Cheers?
questions.explanation:
"Holy mackerel, this isn't Cheers?".

	Al was a very old man and most likely got confused as to which bar he was in. He had only a few lines on the show but they were always funny.

questions.text: What was wrong with the wine Sam gave to Gary's Olde Towne Tavern?
questions.correct: It was served with dribble glasses.
options: It was really just grape juice.
questions.explanation:
It was served with dribble glasses.

	When Al saw the stunt they pulled he said, "Pretty weenie." Sam didn't feel embarrassed at first, but after Al's comment he said, "Now I'm embarrassed."

questions.text: What stunt did Gary's pull on Cheers?
options: They tampered with the kegs so that kool-aid came out instead of beer.
questions.explanation:
They said Cheers had rats.

	Two of Gary's employees pretended to be exterminators. When they said Cheers had a rat problem, most of the customers left the bar.

questions.text: What did Rebecca find in her office?
questions.explanation:
sheep.

	Rebecca declared she would get Gary back. Sam said it was all set.

questions.text: What happened when Gary tried to turn on the boxing match?
questions.correct: Cliff and Norm came on the screen.
options: The boxing match was already over.
questions.explanation:
Cliff and Norm came on the screen.

	Cliff and Norm sat down for an evening of poetry. They then said that if the people at Gary's went to Cheers, drinks would be half price if they said "Gary sent me."

questions.text: Who did Gary send to Cheers?
questions.explanation:
Wade Boggs.

	Wade Boggs was a third baseman. He spent the majority of his career with the Boston Red Sox so the gang at Cheers were big fans of his.

questions.text: What did Carla say when the gang was all excited?
questions.correct: "I'm standing in a room full of idiots."
options: "I can't believe you guys are this stupid."
questions.explanation:
"I'm standing in a room full of idiots."

	Carla thought that Wade Boggs was another one of Gary's tricks. She thought it would be some guy who looked liked Boggs, and that when they all started to fawn all over him, he would laugh at them and tell Gary.

questions.text: What did the gang do to the man who came to the bar to sign autographs?
questions.explanation:
pantsed him.

	It turned out that it really was Wade Boggs, but the gang was so sure Gary was tricking them they didn't believe it. They were upset but then Carla pointed out they had Wade Boggs pants, and then they started to chant "We're number one" to which Al said once again, "Pretty weenie."
